findings.title: Arithmetic Overflow Due to High Priority Fee
findings.description: The runtime encounters an arithmetic overflow when a transaction with a high `priority_fee_per_gas` is processed, leading to a panic.

findings.title: DoS Risk from Vulnerable Dependency
findings.description: The node utilizes an outdated version of the `libp2p` library, which introduces a vulnerability that can lead to Denial-of-Service (DoS) attacks.

findings.title: Unchecked Broadcasted Transactions
findings.description: Broadcasted transactions are unchecked upon reception, potentially allowing a Byzantine node to cause denial of service and network congestion.

findings.title: Execution of Unauthorized Command in Epoch Transactions
findings.description: The absence of checks during the execution of an epoch transaction allows a node to execute a command for which it lacks authorization.

findings.title: Runtime Panic Due to Untimely `NextEpoch` Transaction
findings.description: A runtime panic occurs when a transaction containing a single `NextEpoch` command is submitted by a whitelisted signer.

findings.title: Private Key Stored Unencrypted
findings.description: The node operator's private key is stored in an unencrypted format within a text file named 'keypair.json' in default node configuration settings.

findings.title: Misaligned Pointer Dereference in Wasmer-VM Crate
findings.description: A misaligned pointer dereference vulnerability has been identified in the `wasmer-vm` crate affecting some Apple devices running with ARM64 architecture.

findings.title: Non-Epoch Commands in Epoch Transaction
findings.description: This issue pertains to the epoch block's intended purpose of containing transactions with only the `NextEpoch` command. However, it has been observed that the epoch block can unintentionally accommodate transactions with different commands.

findings.title: Potential Panic Due to Unsafe Balance Management
findings.description: Several unsafe operations pose a risk of integer overflow, potentially leading to panics in the code execution, particularly in balance transfers, stake management, and deposits.

findings.title: Unrestricted `SetPoolSettings` Transactions Despite Whitelist Configuration
findings.description: Despite configuring the node to whitelist the `SetPoolSettings` command for specific accepted signers, a vulnerability exists wherein the command remains unrestricted, allowing any signer to submit transactions with this command.

findings.title: Unsoundness Issue in Borsh Dependency
findings.description: An unsoundness issue has been discovered in the Borsh dependency (version 0.10.2) used by Parallelchain node and its dependencies, relating to potential unsoundness when parsing borsh messages with Zero-Sized Types (ZSTs) that do not implement `Copy` or `Clone` traits.

findings.title: Compilation error due to dependency hotstuff_rs
findings.description: The FullNode repository fails to build due to a compilation error caused by the hotstuff_rs dependency.

findings.title: Correct transactions can be dropped
findings.description: Transactions sent in a batch with a small time gap between them are being dropped due to incorrect implementation of the `insert` function in the `Mempool<NonceProvider>`.

findings.title: Global Mutable Static Variable within Unsafe Block in `rpc::state::view` Function
findings.description: The `view` function in RPC State component uses a global mutable static variable `STATIC_BLOCKTREEDB` within an `unsafe` block, bypassing Rust's safety features and posing potential challenges in future development.

findings.title: Inconsistent Code Formatting
findings.description: A `cargo fmt` check reveals inconsistent formatting in codebase and all crates in scope of the audit.

findings.title: Linter Warnings
findings.description: The codebase has been analyzed using `cargo clippy`, which has generated multiple warnings related to the Fullnode and Network crates.

findings.title: RPC submit_transaction Inadequate Logging Detail
findings.description: The `submit_transaction` handler of the Transaction-related API does not provide adequate information in the event of a transaction failure.

findings.title: std::panic::catch_unwind() usage
findings.description: Usage of `std::panic::catch_unwind()` as a general try/catch mechanism, potentially leading to improper error handling and masking underlying issues or bugs.

findings.title: Test coverage
findings.description: The audit report highlights several components and files with lower test coverage, including rpc, consensus.rs, main.rs, wasmer, non_determinism_filter.rs, error.rs, keys.rs, and states.rs.

findings.title: Unsafe arithmetics
findings.description: The development team has acknowledged the issue concerning unsafe arithmetic operations and has taken proactive steps to address potential concerns.
